LockupCreated(address,int128,uint256,uin.notice: Emitted when a lockup is created

LockupUpdated(address,int128,uint256,int.notice: Emitted when an existing lockup is changed

Withdraw(address,uint256,uint256).notice: Emitted when a user withdraws from an expired lockup

balanceOfAt(address,uint256).details: Gets a users votingWeight at a given blockNumber

params._account: User for which to return the balance
params._blockNumber: Block at which to calculate balance

returns._0: uint256 Balance of user voting power.

checkpoint().details: Public function to trigger global checkpoint.

decimals().details: Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5.05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`). Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the value {ERC20} uses, unless this function is overridden;

delegates(address).details: Get the address `_account` is currently delegating to.

getPastTotalSupply(uint256).details: Retrieve the `totalSupply` at the end of `blockNumber`. This method is required for compatibility with the OpenZeppelin governance ERC20Votes. Requirements: - `_blockNumber` must have been already mined

params._blockNumber: Block at which to calculate total supply

returns._0: uint256 Total supply at the given block

getPastVotes(address,uint256).details: Retrieve the number of votes for `_account` at the end of `_blockNumber`. This method is required for compatibility with the OpenZeppelin governance ERC20Votes. Requirements: - `blockNumber` must have been already mined

getVotes(address).details: Gets the current votes balance for `_account` This method is required for compatibility with the OpenZeppelin governance ERC20Votes.

params._account: Account to get the votes balance for

globalEpoch().notice: globalEpoch important for fetching previous block combined voting power

lockup(uint256,uint256).details: Deposits staking token and mints new veTokens according to the lockup length

params._amount: Amount of staking token to deposit

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

numCheckpoints(address).details: Get the number of checkpoints for `_account`.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate that the this implementation remains valid after an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params._stakingToken: Token that is locked up in return for vote escrowed token

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

totalSupplyAt(uint256).details: Calculates total supply of votingWeight at a given blockNumber

params._blockNumber: Block number at which to calculate total supply

returns._0: totalSupply of voting token weight at the given blockNumber

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

upgradeTo(address).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

userEpoch(address).notice: userEpoch important for fetching previous block per user voting power

withdraw().details: Withdraw all tokens from an expired lockup.
